intro: Pteropsis marginalis, commonly known as the marginal pteropsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive leaves that have a wavy or undulating margin, giving it its scientific name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
